page.title: 11BARNWELL PARK - FACILITIES
page.content: As you go into the park there is a map on the wall at the office which tells you where the lakes are.There is a lot to do in the park like fishing,bird watching and picnics or even just walking around it. Sixth-formers from Prince William School have even done a little simple orienteering there. There is a car park,picnic benches,safety equipment,litter bins,toilets and a new hall extension to the warden's office opened on 25.7.1985. The safety facilities are good. There are alarms and life rings. The park has rules like keeping dogs on leads and you must have a rod licence to fish etc.There is a warden's office in case of emergencies or to get information about the park.Also the park is easy to walk round as there are foot paths and bridges to walk on.
